paragraphs.body: ${link_0}, with its success on ${link_1}, has aired in the channel's other foreign branches. This page is dedicated to the voice actors of these other languages.
paragraphs.text: Avatar: The Last Airbender, with its success on Nickelodeon, has aired in the channel's other foreign branches. This page is dedicated to the voice actors of these other languages.

paragraphs.body: The Dutch version of the show is also shown in Flanders, the northern part of Belgium. There is no Flemish version of the show.
paragraphs.text: The Dutch version of the show is also shown in Flanders, the northern part of Belgium. There is no Flemish version of the show.

paragraphs.body: In the Philippines, the series is simply called Avatar: The Legend of Aang in the dub.
paragraphs.text: In the Philippines, the series is simply called Avatar: The Legend of Aang in the dub.

paragraphs.body: In Finland the series is called Avatar: The Last Airbender, but often referred in TV-guides just as the "Avatar". Book One is called "Vesi", Book Two "Maa", and Book Three "Tuli".

paragraphs.body: In Latin America, the series is referred to as both Avatar: La Leyenda de Aang (Literal translation: Avatar: The Legend of Aang) and Avatar: El Último Maestro Aire (Literal translation: Avatar: The Last Airbender).
paragraphs.text: In Latin America, the series is referred to as both Avatar: La Leyenda de Aang (Literal translation: Avatar: The Legend of Aang) and Avatar: El Último Maestro Aire (Literal translation: Avatar: The Last Airbender).

paragraphs.body: In Latin America, the series is referred to as La Leyenda de Korra (Literal translation: The Legend of Korra)
paragraphs.text: In Latin America, the series is referred to as La Leyenda de Korra (Literal translation: The Legend of Korra)

paragraphs.body: As in Latin America, the series in Spain is referred to as both Avatar: La Leyenda de Aang (Literal translation: Avatar: The Legend of Aang) and Avatar: El Último Maestro Aire (Literal translation: Avatar: The Last Air Master).
paragraphs.text: As in Latin America, the series in Spain is referred to as both Avatar: La Leyenda de Aang (Literal translation: Avatar: The Legend of Aang) and Avatar: El Último Maestro Aire (Literal translation: Avatar: The Last Air Master).
